fields.description:
Current issue tracker options are:

* No issue tracker
* Private issue tracker (Visible only to people with repository access)
* Public issue tracker (Anyone can view, create, and comment on issues)

Can not the following also be an option:

* Private issue tracker + No code access

i.e. allow adding private repo issues by users with private repo access to add private issues? Though the same user is not able to see the code.

Example:\\
Customer X can add issues to the private tracker.. though not see the code...

If unclear let me know.

Thanks, Aubrey
fields.summary: Private Issue tracker option to allow to add issue without code view

fields.description:
If I have a private, paid Bitbucket account, let me have any username that is unique to the private account (rather than unique to bitbucket).

This would allow me to match _in particular_ the naming requirements for JIRA and Confluence (as well as email in a private domain), and avoid the following problematic issue: I set up a JIRA and a Confluence account, _then_ choose to add Bitbucket, and now find that my private JIRA and Confluence usernames are taken in public Bitbucket (please note that changing a username in JIRA and Confluence is... not exactly a cakewalk.)
fields.summary: User name for a private account (BB-12113)

fields.description: Bitbucket is deleting my branches when I try to merge and the merge fails with conflicts and I have checked the "close source branch" box. I have experienced this issue multiple times with different feature branches merging back into Development branch.
fields.summary: Branches getting deleted when merge fails (BB-12112)

fields.description:
Hi,

When trying to clone a repo I'm getting this error.\\
Repo: https://bitbucket.org/jeanfrg/royaltyline-mobile-app

Any Idea how I could solve this?

Error:\\
C:\tmp>hg clone ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/jeanfrg/royaltyline-mobile-app\\
destination directory: royaltyline-mobile-app\\
requesting all changes\\
adding changesets\\
adding manifests\\
adding file changes\\
transaction abort!\\
rollback completed\\
abort: stream ended unexpectedly (got 130129 bytes, expected 132901)\\
remote: abort: empty or missing revlog for App/public/app/controllers/home-controller.js.orig

Thanks in advance,\\
Jean
fields.summary: I've got this error: "remote: abort: empty or missing revlog"

fields.description:
Hello

I need to add my project to a bitbucket repository. I got the following error .

root@rvtech-pc:/home/rvtech/Desktop/new/new# git push -u origin master\\
*conq: repository access denied. deployment key is not associated with the requested repository.*\\
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly\\
root@rvtech-pc:/home/rvtech/Desktop/new/new# git push -u origin master\\
Warning: Permanently added the RSA host key for IP address '131.103.20.167' to the list of known hosts.\\
conq: repository access denied. deployment key is not associated with the requested repository.\\
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly\\
root@rvtech-pc:/home/rvtech/Desktop/new/new# git push origin master\\
conq: repository access denied. deployment key is not associated with the requested repository.\\
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly

Its very urgent, let me know what to do.

Regards
fields.summary: Deployment key - error

fields.description:
In developing a new OAuth integration, I had a bug where my Authorization header included "oauth_timestamp=1.42333209929e+12" rather than "oauth_timestamp=1423332099290".

Unlike most mistakes in formatting the Authorization header, this produced a 500 HTTP error, not a 401 or 403 HTTP error. I suspect I hit an edge case in Bitbucket's OAuth header parser.
fields.summary: 500 error when oauth_timestamp is in scientific notation (BB-12111)

fields.description: When viewing the overview of a pull request that includes more than one diff'd file while using Russian as your user language, an error is shown instead of any file diffs
fields.summary: Cannot view pull request diffs in Russian (BB-12086)

fields.description: no syntax highlighting of R code
fields.summary: syntax highlighting (BB-12081)

fields.description:
My team makes fairly heavy use of the Bitbucket to HipChat integration, and whilst it's great, there is one problem in that - for a busy repo - it can be quite noisy as you currently _can't_ filter notifications by branch.

We have lots of development teams working various releases etc and each team would like to only see notifications relating to branches they're working on in their respective HipChat rooms.
fields.summary: Allow Filtering of Bitbucket to HitChat Notifications by Branch (BB-12082)

fields.description:
I've had a few instances where developers have pushed tags accidentally/in error. After this point it's really difficult to get rid of them in a big team as - once they're on the remote - they tend to keep reappearing even if they're deleted as other developers end up with them in their local repos and re-pushing them accidentally.

It would be amazing if it was possible to restrict who had permission to push tags to a Bitbucket hosted Git repo in the first place to stop this happening.
fields.summary: Restrict Pushing Git Tags to Certain Users in a Bitbucket Repo (BB-12083)

fields.description:
Hello.\\
My new imported svn rpo https://bitbucket.org/xvortex/dd-wrt hungs at import.\\
Please fix or delete.
fields.summary: Repo hung at import.

fields.description:
Whenever I edit a source file online in bitbucket and do it via pull request, I set reviewers but it never retains them. The pull request that is created has no reviewers. This has happened to me at least half a dozen times, and I have seen it happen to others on my team.\\
Either the reviewers should be added to the pull request, or it shouldn't provide the option to add them if it won't honor it.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like a Pull Request generated by the Source Code Editor to retain reviewer IDs (BB-12055)

fields.description:
h2. Issue
At times, pull requests could sit idle for days, maybe weeks.  Sometimes it'll be ignored when in reality, the branch needs to be merged.  You could write a comment which will notify all reviewers but now your pull request has meaningless comments.

h2. Solution
Create a Nudge button for pull requests.  This will simply notify all reviewers that there's a pull request left unattended.  Some info on pull request would be useful also:

* Pull request date
* Reviewers
* Who has reviewed it (if the person has reviewed it, there will be a message in the alert that says "You have approved this but still waiting for others: John1, John2, John3).
* A color indicator/flag that correlates to the length of time it's been idle: Yellow (3 days), Red (4+ days), etc.
fields.summary: "Nudge" all users for a pull request (BB-12054)

fields.description:
I've just started using Bitbucket after being a solid Bitbucket Server (Stash) users for over a year. The Stash "Diff" view for pull requests is much better than the one for Bitbucket.

The file tree view on the left makes it considerably easier to look through the files that have changed. I'd like to see this functionality integrated into Bitbucket.
fields.summary: Tree view for navigating pull requests

fields.description:
Hello,

We have been having trouble pushing across our accounts for the past week.

First it was alston@gamepill.com that could not commit and now it is albert@gamepill.com
fields.summary: Gamepill team // albert bushara (albert@gamepill.com)

fields.description:
From a customer:

Our QA folks are read only users but in our workflow we'd like them to create the pull requests. They get an "access denied" when trying to do so. Is there some way to grant a read only user the ability to create a pull request?
fields.summary: As a read-only user, I would like to be able to create a pull-request to start the review process. (BB-12049)

fields.description: Right now it always defaults to *default*.  We use the Hg Flow branching pattern, so this means that developers are "encouraged" to merge into our master branch.  I'd like to see the branch defaulting get a little smarter.
fields.summary: Default branch for pull request to source (direct ancestor) branch (BB-12045)

fields.description:
I am having a problems fetching one repo from Bitbucket.

My account came with the prebuilt "tutorial" demo. Pulling this repo works perfectly fine, for all the scenarios describe below.

My account has also been added to a private repo. For this repo I can clone / checkin / whatever from Eclipse.\\
I have set up Jenkins running in a VM. From Jenkins I only get the error: "Error fetching remote repo 'origin'". Note that from this same Jenkins I can clone my "tutorial" repo just fine!\\
I am trying to use https and username+password for all cases.

What else can I check?
fields.summary: Jenkins: Error fetching remote repo 'origin'

fields.description:
Hi!\\
Is it possible to add "mikroPascal" as a programming language option for bitbucket projects?\\
This is one from compilators lineup developed by 'mikro' (Mikroelectronika, Belgrade: mirroPascal, mikroC, mikroBasic).\\
Thanks!
fields.summary: mikroPascal as an option for projects (BB-12037)

fields.description:
If I view some German characters in Raw, it does not display some characters properly:

!317253452-buggy.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Not able to display some characters properly on Raw. (BB-12039)

fields.description:
That could be a convention in the same way there is a {{Home.md}} at the root of the wiki repo there could be an {{'images}} folder too.

Should probably be optional though as AWS is ok for some/most people.
fields.summary: Commit images added to the wiki in the wiki repository instead of storing them on AWS (BB-12038)

fields.description:
This is a critical issue. Please do not mark it as invalid or resolved before the problem is fixed, like the other reports of this issue which are marked as resolved and left dead while dozens of users are confirming the issue...

Pulling a repository of size ~200mb with ~200 objects.

I have increased my postbuffer to 524288000.

Output:\\
fatal: early EOF

fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly\\
fatal: index-pack failed

error: RPC failed; result=18, HTTP code = 200
fields.summary: Fatal: Early EOF

i get this error when i try pushing a commit

{code}
git push
Counting objects: 108, done.
Delta compression using up to 8 threads.

Writing objects: 100% (66/66), 13.68 KiB | 0 bytes/s, done.

{code}

i see this here this issue and it looks the same, but don't know how to resolve it\\

chauhan

From the documentation and the API apigee page, when I try to send a team/repositories I receive a 301. I have authenticated correctly, and all other teams Endpoint seem to work. Only the repositories seems to fail.

Based on this documentation:\\
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/teams+Endpoint?replyToComment=702716739&#comment-702716739

fields.description: Im not sure why but i cannot create a repo at all. When i click create, the button is grayed out. And even when i fill everything out, including the repo name, it is still grayed out. It doesnt tell me why.
fields.summary: create repository grayed out.

fields.description:
When I create a new pull request, I always have to scroll through the diff to see what I have changed. Each time I find something, I have to scroll back up, write it in the Description, and then scroll back down to where I left off.

I know better organisation on my part would make this easier but this would be a lovely enhancement.
fields.summary: New Pull-Request page: Keep description in view when scrolling through the diff (BB-12024)

fields.description: The Recent Activity in our private repository (https://bitbucket.org/c3gdb/tests) shows a commit for an unknown, unrelated repository (https://bitbucket.org/DaPhoenix/rfreedommodv2.0).
fields.summary: Recent Activity shows commit for another, unknown repository (BB-12020)

fields.description:
When trying to change a private repo to public, after trying to remove the check box "This is a\\
private repository", forking dropdown disappears and when trying to save the settings, an error will occur saying "Public repositories must allow forks"

Attempting to edit the Forking dropdown options and saving will cause it to revert to the old setting
fields.summary: Unable to change a private repo to public & fork dropdown settings bug(BB-12019)

fields.description:
bitbucket REST API 1.0 user/repositories endpoint returns incorrect owner in some cases.

I have a REPRODUCIBLE scenario.

For user "kmurphey" (that is me):\\
https://bitbucket.org/api/1.0/user/repositories returns wrong owner (gnetsman) for repository slug="searchmassive".

https://bitbucket.org/api/1.0/repositories/blinkxdev/searchmassive returns the correct creator (kmurphey).

bitbucket web ui, repository access management, shows the correct owner (kmurphey).
fields.summary: bitbucket REST API 1.0 user/repositories endpoint returns incorrect owner in some cases

fields.description:
We've got a pull request in a Mercurial repository that won't allow the requester to select "Close [branch] after the pull request is merged." The checkbox is disabled, with a message that "Branch deletion is disabled for this branch". [This page|https://blog.bitbucket.org/2013/09/16/take-control-with-branch-restrictions/] makes it sound like that's a feature intended for Git repositories. In the repository's settings, we don't have any restrictions on deleting bookmarks, and the UI specifically says that this shouldn't restrict branch closure even if there were.

Other branches on the same repository don't seem to have any problems. Could the branch name ending in "." be causing this?
fields.summary: Incorrect "Branch deletion is disabled for this branch" message (BB-12018)
Add commit approval date to "GET an individual commit" API (BB-12017)

fields.description: Every time someone forks a project where I'm mentioned in a commit message I get a mail notification for that particular commit, e.g. https://bitbucket.org/fschulze/tox/commits/7ca156
fields.summary: Forking send notifications when mentioned in commit

fields.description:
Once 4 files and above are attached in the Issues section, the thumbnails of the files will appear too closely to each other:

!4271477234-bug2-2%20-%20Copy.PNG|thumbnail!

!3233133293-bug2-1.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Attached-files' thumbnails in Issues appear too close to each other (BB-12015)

fields.description:
Hi.

We have a repo in Bitbucket, which we use as a central repo. We update it via pull requests or directly by pushing new changes to it, and we synchronize those changes in remote servers by pulling from it.

This has been working like a charm for about a year, but now we are not able to pull changes from this repo to update a remote server:

{code}
#!bash

$ git pull origin
remote: Total 0 (delta 0), reused 0 (delta 0)
error: unable to find dcdff3f40bfc450ec8d5326ff12bc03e160bde1f
fatal: object dcdff3f40bfc450ec8d5326ff12bc03e160bde1f not found
{code}

*Even if I try to clone it the same error appears.* The commit exists, so the error make no sense: https://bitbucket.org/encore-lab/encore-framework/commits/dcdff3f40bfc450ec8d5326ff12bc03e160bde1f

Nonetheless, this object/commit is available from Bitbucket and also in my local machine (where I generated it and then pushed to the central repo).

No matters if I push more commits to the repository, when I try to pull the repo to get last commits it always shows me that the last commit doesn't exist.

I've tried other ways, for example (but none of them worked at the moment):

{code}
#!bash

$ git gc
$ git fsck --full
$ git reflog expire --expire=0 --all
{code}

I also reset to the previous state of the repo and re-apply the changes again but it didn't work either.

So I would like to know if there's a problem with that repository in Bitbucket. I have just tried to fork it and the problem disappears with the forked repository - which has exactly the same commits as the primary repo.

The repository is this: https://bitbucket.org/encore-lab/encore-framework (it's private, so I hope you -staff members- could access it).

Can anyone help me out here? Thanks in advance.
fields.summary: Unable to find <last-commit>

fields.description: If this is private information, please use our private issue tracker at support.atlassian.com-while creating a new branch, called "develop". I created an old branch with the same name. Can I use that branch again?Please let us know the name of the repository ,,?
fields.summary: I have problem while creating a new branch, called

fields.description: * With it turned on, room members would receive a notification once a commit is pushed to a repo.I was wondering why I stopped getting notifications, then I realized it's because GitHub does it but not BitBucket. +1,,-Please add this feature to the HipChat add-on. We wanted to use the HipChat integration to our BitBucket team repository, but
fields.summary: Hello, the HipChat hook is working fine,

fields.description:
For Bitbucket I'm using 150% zoom in Chrome. Have this issue:

!1122732856-5rK0xbR.png|thumbnail!

As you can see on screenshot, there's vertical align issue on highlighted text blocks.

For unknown reason there's {{margin-top: -1px}}. I think that rule can be removed.

fields.description:
We have had to set up a manual operational task to make sure that none of our team members create public repositories.  I'd really like to be able to control this from REPO Creation by having a setting in my team account.

Make the Repository Creation a workflow.

# What account do you want to create a repository for?
# Main Form (with fields restricted depending on team security settings).

this would make administration of our repositories much easier and avoid an oh-oh situation.
fields.summary: Restrict Team Account to only be able to create Private Repositories

fields.description:
I noticed this while commenting in BCLOUD-5655: user names which contain a period (".") are not linked correctly.

I hope @vinay.sajip doesn't mind being used as an example. The correct link should look more like: [{{vinay.sajip}}|https://bitbucket.org/vinay.sajip].

See also BCLOUD-7915

fields.description:
The difference in commits is not displayed in the request-pull interface.\\
Instead, the difference in the modified lines are shown the same lines that have not been changed.

fields.description:
Hello, I have recently (wednesday 21st to be more precise) been trying to create a BitBucket account, but as soon as I entered my informations, the website showed me this error : "Your account has been deactivated. Please contact Bitbucket Support for assistance."

I tried a few times with the usernames "arnaudf75" , "arnaudf93" , and "arnaudf7" ,but the error message still showed up.

I would like to know if it's possible to delete "arnaudf93" and "arnaudf7" and just keep the first one "arnaudf75".

Thank you for your help !

fields.description: Hi, can you remove unavailable repository https://bitbucket.org/partstech/git-repo.lutacom.net-partstech ?

fields.description:
Hi,\\
I am trying to configure a custom domain for the repository lupino3.bitbucket.org, but I added the custom domain while the DNS settings were not fully correct, so I think I caused negative DNS caching.

The domain is correctly configured now, but I cannot add it because I get a DNS error.

Could you flush the DNS cache so I can configure it?

Thanks,\\
Andrea
fields.summary: Cannot add custom domain (possibly negative DNS caching)

fields.description:
Hi!

I'm looking for a way to send a notification (or mention) to team's group from issue comments like {{@<group_id>}} or {{@<team_id>/<group_id>}}. It would be really useful in cases when we have our team divided into groups like designers, backend, testers etc.
fields.summary: Group mentions are needed (BB-11984)

fields.description:
Regarding relatively new feature Pull Request Tasks, as discussed in blog post https://blog.bitbucket.org/2014/09/16/introducing-pull-request-tasks/.

Would be even more useful if you did not need to first add a comment. Most times, the task description is trivial and does not require any further explanation, so it would be faster to just add a task than to add a comment and then a task.

Common examples: "add a comment", "use a more descriptive variable name", "retest this".
fields.summary: Ability to create a task without first adding a comment

fields.description:
Pressing the "blame" button no longer shows the blame view.  The page shows a refreshing spinner briefly, but reloads the same view as before the button was toggled on.

This must have changed recently as I use the blame view quite often.

Firefox 35.0 on Windows.
fields.summary: Blame view no longer working (BB-11983)

fields.description:
I need to hide some millestones, status or version to some users in my project, but i can´t do it.

Thanks you.
fields.summary: I can't modify the filters per user

fields.description:
I've encountered a bug where if the group has a long name, and I add that group in the access management section within a repository, it affects the view of the permission section. Here it goes.

This is the usual normal view before adding a group at the access management of a repo:

!1464345157-bug1.PNG|thumbnail!

This is how it usually looks like after adding a group with a short name:

!4041385951-bug2.PNG|thumbnail!

And this is how it looked like when I added a group that has a real long name:

!2709508483-bug3.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Group Name Length Affects Access Management View

fields.description:
Hi team,

When I trying to push some code to gitbuket, it returns ssl error, do you have any idear about how to fix that?

$ git push origin master\\
error: Unknown SSL protocol error in connection to bitbucket.org:443  while accessing https://wuyihorse@bitbucket.org/wuyihorse/backup.git/info/refs\\
fatal: HTTP request failed

If I switch to ssh protocol, it shows another error:

$ ssh -Tvvv git@bitbucket.org\\
OpenSSH_6.6.1, OpenSSL 1.0.1g 7 Apr 2014\\
debug2: ssh_connect: needpriv 0\\
debug1: Connecting to bitbucket.org [131.103.20.168] port 22.\\
debug1: Connection established.\\

debug1: Enabling compatibility mode for protocol 2.0\\
debug1: Local version string SSH-2.0-OpenSSH_6.6.1\\
ssh_exchange_identification: read: Software caused connection abort

Thanks\\
Yi

fields.description:
I wanted to make a feature request.

On this page: https://bitbucket.org/user/repo/commits/branch/default

It would be nice if when I hovered over a list icon per row item, if a preview popup showed me a list of files modified in the commit. This would help in the audit process, when trying to quickly determine which users touched which files recently. I've made a proposed mockup to communicate the idea.

Thanks!

Chase
fields.summary: Provide summary of files modified per commit in commit list (BB-11972)

fields.description:
That's not the first time it's happening. And not the first time it's happening *today* so while we can re-create branch and so on I decided to report this as it's clearly a bug and it's getting common disrupting out processes.

This PR reports lots of changes that should not be there:\\
https://bitbucket.org/wfmdigitalweb/wfmcom/pull-request/1392/qd-1572-create-functional-snapshot-those/diff

QD-1572 does not exist in wfmcom so difference in this Pull Request should be shown between incoming branch oleksii_melnichenko/wfmcom:QD-1572 and target master wfmdigitalweb/wfmcom:master.

Here is correct Diff:\\
https://bitbucket.org/oleksii_melnichenko/wfmcom/branches/compare/oleksii_melnichenko/wfmcom:QD-1572..wfmdigitalweb/wfmcom:master#diff

But that's not the diff that is displayed in PR. Instead PR displays lot's of other files. We had similar problems with other branches before. Including today.

fields.description:
I did find a similar issue marked as won't fix regarding distinctness of headers (https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/6158/markdown-rendered-font-sizes-for-h1-h2-and), but I'm hoping this issue is sufficiently different.

Currently, .markup h3-h6 have font-weight set to bold.  This makes it difficult to tell which has the greater emphasis between h2 and h3.  Would it be possible to either increase the font weight for h1 and h2, or remove the font-weight for h3-6, specifically for .markup?

In the following screenshots, "Projects" is ## (h2) while "AzureHost..." is ### (h3):

Currently: http://puu.sh/ePld9/c1476b381e.png

All bold: http://puu.sh/ePlp7/55db5683ac.png

All normal: http://puu.sh/ePlsV/fdbb6dea52.png

Thanks,

Tommy Long\\
tommy.long@4com.co.uk
fields.summary: Inconsistent Markdown Formatting (h3 is bold, but not h1 and h2) (BB-11964)

fields.description:
Hi,

For easier pull-requests it whould be great to be able to select conflicted files in a review of the pull-request  for resolving the conflicts.

For Example you have a pull-request with 30 Files changed.\\
1 is a conflict , so  you can select "use theirs" or "use mine" on that file.

Best,

Malte

fields.description:
Hello,

I am the lead developer at a premium WordPress plugin development agency, and we're currently working on an integration with BitBucket. The first problem, however, is that I am unable to even request a token so that the user can authenticate access to their BitBucket account. This is the url that I am attempting to browse to:

https://bitbucket.org/api/1.0/oauth/request_token?oauth_version=1.0&oauth_nonce=d799ffdce7ffaa13f8239a406875e081&oauth_timestamp={timestamp}&oauth_consumer_key={key}&oauth_signature_method=HMAC-SHA1&oauth_signature={secret}&oauth_callback=http%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%2Ftest%2F

The url was generated using the testing site recommended on the BitBucket documentation page here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/OAuth+on+bitbucket

It's also worth pointing out that the testing site recommended on the document listed above doesn't allow requesting an initial request token, because it doesn't send an oauth_callback parameter. Therefore, the BitBucket API just returns an error every time you attempt to use it.

I have tried every permutation of the url above that I can think of, using PLAINTEXT, generating a new APP with new keys/secrets, generating new timestamps. Nothing has worked.

My goal with this plugin is to allow users to download tags as zip files from private and public repos. I'm thinking that I can do something like:

https://bitbucket.org/{user}/{repo}/get/{branch,tag}.{zip,tar.gz,tar.bz}

and pass the authentaicated OAuth token as a parameter to access the zip file.

We have been working on this integration for a few weeks, and we would like to get this plugin into the hands of our users as quickly as possible.

Thank you very much for the time.

If you need more information from me, please let me know.
fields.summary: Errors when requesting an OAuth token

fields.description: If I head to a nonexistant subdomain such as username.bitbucket.org and click login I get a URL like this http://username.bitbucket.org/account/signin/?next=/hosted/omgimalexis/account/signin/%3Fnext%3D/hosted/omgimalexis/account/signin/%253Fnext%253D/hosted/omgimalexis/ and it just keeps adding the redirect link to the end as I click the login button each time instead of going back to the base URL bitbucket.org with the login link at the end.
fields.summary: Login button on 404 pages for subdomains don't work (BB-11935)

fields.description:
It would be extremely continent if a pull request's "body" was auto-populated from the "body" of a commit.

For example, the commit message:

bq. foo: Fix the broken thing

Some descriptive stuff about how the thing was broken, and what was done to fix it.  This is separated by the first ("header") line by two newlines.


Should yield a PR with:

*title*: "foo: Fix the broken thing"

*body*: "Some descriptive stuff about how the thing was broken, and what was done to fix it.  This is separated by the first ("header") line by two newlines."

----
GitHub does this and it saves me from having to copy/paste my commit messages over and over again.
fields.summary: Auto-populate pull request "body" with commit message (BB-11936)

fields.description:
The body of the response for a POST hook contains a root node called 'payload', which is serialized/escaped. This has been mentioned as far back as mid 2013 [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/POST%2Bhook%2Bmanagement%3Futm_source%3DSAC%26utm_medium%3Ddashboard]:

Please consider updating the response or the documentation.

Nick.

fields.description:
I pushed a new branch to our project. After more than a day, the commits on that branch were visible in the Commits page but the branch itself was not visible in the Branches view. This issue was not limited to my account - other teammates could not see the branch.

After clicking through "branch" link on the Commit page, the "Branch details" page (the view that is rendered when clicking on a branch in the Branches view) was visible. After returning to the Branches view, the branch was still not visible (refreshed the cache on my browser and still no luck).

Repeating the above process of going Commits -> [specific commit] -> Branch details ultimately made the branch visible in the Branches view.
fields.summary: Branch missing from "Branches" view
